docs.snippet: What if instead of anxiously worrying about criticism, you excitedly welcomed it?

headline.main: Why It’s So Hard to Hear Negative Feedback

docs.snippet: Leave it to the hipsters of Brooklyn to combine craft beer and sharp objects.

docs.snippet: European Union leaders gave a cautious welcome on Thursday to news that U.S. President Donald Trump had decided not to apply tariffs to European steel and aluminum but said they were waiting for Washington to confirm that decision.

headline.print_headline: EU Leaders Receive Positive News on Trump Tariffs
headline.main: EU Leaders Receive Positive News on Trump Tariffs

docs.snippet: Federal investigators on Thursday combed through the home of the 23-year-old they say was behind this month's deadly Texas bombing spree, seeking clues about what motivated his attacks the day after he killed himself in a confrontation with police...

headline.print_headline: Investigators Scour Texas Bomber's Home, Searching for a Motive
headline.main: Investigators Scour Texas Bomber's Home, Searching for a Motive

docs.snippet: Austria's foreign ministry has recalled an employee of its embassy in Israel after an Austrian weekly said he posted a picture of himself on social media wearing a T-shirt bearing the name of a Nazi tank division.

headline.print_headline: Austria Recalls Embassy Employee From Israel Over Nazi Shirt
headline.main: Austria Recalls Embassy Employee From Israel Over Nazi Shirt

docs.snippet: Steel-cut oats, toasted in brown butter and cooked with unsweetened cocoa, makes the average bowl of porridge all the more sophisticated.

headline.print_headline: Yes, Adults Can Have Chocolate for Breakfast. Really.
headline.main: Yes, Adults Can Have Chocolate for Breakfast. Really.

docs.snippet: A senior Pakistani policeman accused of a role in police killings surrendered to the Supreme Court on Wednesday after two months on the run, media said, in a case that has stirred anger about extra-judicial killings.

headline.print_headline: Fugitive Pakistani Policeman Surrenders to Face Extra-Judicial Killings Inquiry
headline.main: Fugitive Pakistani Policeman Surrenders to Face Extra-Judicial Killings Inquiry

docs.snippet: Major U.S. stock indexes fell as much as 2 percent on Thursday, where they looked on track for the steepest drop since a Wall Street rout six weeks ago, in anticipation of an announcement by U.S. President Donald Trump that had traders concerned a...

headline.print_headline: Instant View: U.S. Stocks Tumble on Trade Worries
headline.main: Instant View: U.S. Stocks Tumble on Trade Worries

docs.snippet: Norwegian Justice Minister Sylvi Listhaug quit on Tuesday to avert a collapse of the minority government after she caused uproar with comments accusing the opposition of being lenient on militant suspects.

headline.print_headline: Norway's Justice Minister Quits to Avert Government Collapse
headline.main: Norway's Justice Minister Quits to Avert Government Collapse

docs.snippet: Melania Trump pushed back against critics Tuesday, declaring her commitment to combating cyberbullying despite the hits she has endured for taking on the issue while her husband routinely goes on Twitter to berate foes and call them names.

headline.print_headline: First Lady Vows to Fight Cyberbullying Despite Critics
headline.main: First Lady Vows to Fight Cyberbullying Despite Critics
